column3: > This is similar to functionality in most password managers and is specifically added with the use case of password managers in mind\n\nI don't entirely follow how this helps with password managers. As far as I know, you already paste into both the new password and confirm password fields?

The idea is that say you miss the actual password copy, or you copy the wrong entry, or you use the middle-click paste (Linux distros) instead of system clipboard paste, etc. - any disconnect between what you think you are putting in that field and what is actually put in that field.\n\nI realize this may be a rarer use case, but an option to unblind the password field is an increasingly common

`auto` is one of the rare items in C++11 I go back and forth on.
